sense.name: human weakness, generally
sense.commentary: Refers to the general evil in the world, not a specific kind. A mass noun.
sense.examples: Las Vegas is a wretched hive of vice and villainy. He's a man weighed down with vice and greed.

sense.name: a specific or personal weakness
sense.commentary: A type of human weakness, or one person's. Can have indeterminatives. A count noun.
sense.examples: Gambling has always been my vice. He's a man of many vices, but womanizing worst among them.

sense.name: police subgroup
sense.commentary: The part of a police force dedicated to regulating a specific type of crime, such as prostitution. Usually capitalized. The television show 'Miami Vice' referred to this sense.
sense.examples: John worked on Vice for thirty years. We sent our Vice Squad to investigate.
